title: Abu-Naim
author: Abu-Naim
content: Hi all, My name is Abu-Naim, I am new here.I discovered this forum while conducting research for bitcoin-related advice before beginning any Bitcoin investment because I lack sufficient knowledge about bitcoin.When I first discovered this forum, I saw so many topics in various sections in which I was trying to ask some questions, but there was no way, I only see previous and next topic up there until I registered an account, and now I see that I can reply and create my own topic as well, I hope I am fully welcomed.Please direct me to the sections where I can get good recommendations on the types of wallets to use, as well as basic information about the wallet and how the Bitcoin wallet works.Thank you all.

comments.author: Little Mouse
comments.body: Welcome.You should use Hardware wallet, I'm pretty sure you have heard about Hardware wallet. Try Trezor or Ledger. Make sure you learn about them properly before you use them to store your private keys.If you can't afford a hardware wallet and want an easy UI wallet, bitcoin core or electrum is the best. Bitcoin Core will require you to sync with the blockchain history, a time consuming process. So, electrum would be the best fit. However, these are hot wallet. It's always good to use cold wallet.For learning more about wallet, you can visit this section- https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?board=37.0
